material.mattext: Obtain the 95% confidence interval for μ<font size="9">1</font> - μ<font size="9">2</font> and interpret it in context. To use the above formula, you need the value for t*. It turns out that the calculation for t* is very complex, so I'll give it to you - it is 1.96 for this study.

Plugging the study results into the above formula gives us a 95% confidence interval of (3.091, 6.709). This means that with 95% confidence, we can say that males who are 20-29 years old weigh, on average, 3.1 to 6.7 kilograms more than males who are 75 and older.
